website_summaries.verdict: Excellent build quality in a dog tie-out stake that works for large dogs.
pros: This stake has 28" in length, so it can be driven deeply into the ground
It can handle large animals, even if you're working in really soft ground
Has a bright orange color, so you will always be able to see exactly where it is
Solid steel with powder coating to resist rust
cons: May be difficult to drive the stake completely in rocky or dry ground

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, holds up against our aggressive dog
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this stake for almost a year, and I am very pleased with it. Our dog is ROUGH when she is outside. Not only is she able to jump over our fence, she is able to plow through our pickets! If she smells a bunny, all bets are off. This stake has done a fantastic job holding her in our yard. The only thing I can possibly grasp at to complain about is that the color is fading and chipping, but it has been outside for a year, what would you expect.
customer_reviews.author: JMo

customer_reviews.title: 75 pound German Shepard mix
customer_reviews.text: I have a 75 pound German Shepard mix. She is real smart and really strong. We have no fences in our yard and we live on top of a hill. We have had this tie down stake for three years. My dog is a beast and she will go after a squirrel or a cat with all her might. It is still holding her strong. Through winters and rain. It looks a bit beat up, but it still does the job. I’m about to order a a second one. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: nik

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I am returning these stakes after attempting to use them. Our dogs are strong and we needed good stakes to keep them contained while camping. After reading the other reviews. I am not convinced I didnt experience user error. However, we tried these first in our yard as a test run and were extremely disappointed. Once you begin to twist the stake in the ground, it simply augers a hole the size of the stake and then slips right out of the dirt. If you poured concrete around the stakes they would be nice, but we need them to be mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Philhart

customer_reviews.title: Great product...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for a large dog! Goes deep and doesn't budge. Best thing is the swivel, NO More twisted cable. I used a 30 ft cable so when my dog goes outside he can run with this and I don't worry about him roaming the neighborhood, but he can safely be outside a bit, unsupervised without me worrying he will pull the stake up like the cheap silver store bought ones. I plan to buy a second one for the front yard.
customer_reviews.author: Tlm28146

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for about a month. We have our 80lb lab mix out on it 4-5x a day, and have not had an issue. Our dog however, is not actively trying to get loose or pull the steak from the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Haley M

customer_reviews.title: The Four Paws tie-out is designed much better. It hasn't budged
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised. I used to have one of the helical-type ones, and my dog running around it in circles would always come close to pulling it out of the ground. The Four Paws tie-out is designed much better. It hasn't budged. It is harder to install, but worth it! I highly recommend using a broom handle, sticking it through the loop, and just walking around clockwise in circles. May take a few minutes. Try not to get too dizzy. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Good stake - has worked well.
customer_reviews.text: This take retards my 80 pound greyhound, but also has enough height that i can clearly see it when I mow the yard. I have used stakes in the past that only worked when they were fully in the ground - which is fine until you hit them with the mower or trip over them. The stake was also very easy to screw in to clay. i will say that using a rod or something to run through the eyelight improves installation as there is not a great deal to hold onto to get leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: No more stake being ripped out the ground!
customer_reviews.text: When our fence came down thanks to Irma we had to switch to dog tie outs to give our dogs some daily exercise. We found out that our Golden loves to play with her "sister" dalmatian and will pull up stakes, break tie out cables, and pop open plastic collars to get to her. This stake put an end to the stake being ripped out the ground issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge stake for big boys.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for out pit bull who destroys those regular spiral stakes you find at WalMart. This this is massive. It is made of very heavy gage steel and it solid and heavy. It takes forever to get screwed into the ground since the spiral screw part does not have much of an angle on it. I used a fiberglass rake handle thru the hole on top to screw it into the ground so I wouldn't chip the paint. The paint is very florescent and will be easy to see when the grass gets green. Also bought the Beast cable and I don't think big boy will get getting off of this any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Go Tigers !

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't as easy as I thought to put it in the ground ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my Staffordshire Terriers and have no regrets. It wasn't as easy as I thought to put it in the ground maybe do to rocks in soil but thanks to a couple of my "heavier" friends they got it into the ground. One of them pulled up on it and it didn't budge. I am very confident in the stake holding my dogs and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DF

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tie out
customer_reviews.text: This sucker is STURDY! Once it's in the ground it's not going anywhere. That being said, getting it all the way into the ground is a lot of work. Other reviewers mentioned putting a broom handle in the hole to help turn it into the ground. I'm not sure how you could do it any other way. Took me and my husband about an hour to get it all the way in. The ground was probably still a bit frozen though. Someone mentioned being able to mow right over it. I don't see how that's possible because there's a large metal circle on the top (seen in photo).
customer_reviews.author: A.C

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Every time it would rain a few days and the ground would get soft my dog would work the old stake out of the ground and he would run off getting tangled in the woods. He is my hunting dog so i knew where to find him each time but its stressful to look out in the yard and you dog and chain are gone. So i purchased this item and couldn't be happier with it. he has not as much as budged it loose not one time i was cautious at first but after the first month it was still solid i could finally relax. Its a great product for a highly active dog.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Riley

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad at first
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a camping trip: first trip with our new, 65-75lb pitt-mix rescue. This stake turnss into the earth and feels really secure going in, but we had the dog on a long lead and when he hit the end of the tether, at full pitt-puppy force, the stake bent. Not to bad at first, but by the end of the week long trip, it either wouldn't stay in the ground or wouldn't come out because of the damage. We ended up digging it out before we left. I do not reccomend this for campsites where the rock bed is close.
customer_reviews.author: loyalAmazonian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Stake!
customer_reviews.text: Great Tie out Stake. It is very secure in the ground - and VERY Deep!. I have two good sized dogs who are very strong, and energetic, and there is no way they're going to get this one loose. Where many Others have failed, this one did not disappoint. This purchase was my second one.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Tocco

customer_reviews.title: Stake It
customer_reviews.text: We use this product to tie up our female Great Dane (110 LBS) while we're camping. It works like a charm. I find it a bit hard to dig into the hard ground so usually I grab a big rock near by and smack it into the ground. Then I twist the stake until I get the claw part into the ground. Once its secure I tie up my dog and she stays put. For the long leash or tie I use the "Boss Pet Prestige Beast Dog Tie Out with Spring"
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Schooley

customer_reviews.title: Fair
customer_reviews.text: If you have anything except maybe sand in your yard you can get this in. It just bends the light weight sheet metal screw. I had to grind it off and drive it in the ground to make it work
customer_reviews.author: Rick H

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tie-out stake
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tie-out stake. It easily (with a bar inserted in the top ring) wound all the way down into the ground next to the corner of my house. I use it for my grand-dogs when they visit and need to use the yard for their business. I also use the 250-lb cable - not because they are huge dogs, but at 65 pounds, I don't want to be the reason a dog is loose. No worries about that with this stake!
customer_reviews.author: User1

customer_reviews.title: Pulled right out of the ground on the first try....
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, a complete waste of money....our 65-pound Standard Poodle pulled this right out of the ground in 30 seconds after we secured it solidly. I was SO hoping this would be something we could use to have our dog enjoy some time outdoors with us outside the fence. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BookLover

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: decent quality/sturdiness but very hard to install (perhaps my ground)
customer_reviews.author: RLD

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, just doesn't stay put in sand!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well holding my 35lb yellow lab/golden mix pup in sand. But we will be trying again on our next camping trip in some dirt to see how it holds up there. It seems pretty sturdy, but just kept getting loose in the sand at our last lake trip. Will update post once we're back
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Vegetables

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Pros -Perfect for my 60 lb dog -Very sturdy Cons -Paint chips easily ( who cares? ) -Hard to screw in ground even with the leverage. ( I just got my 6'4 Dad to get it all the way down! ) Make sure you put it all the way in the ground, don't fool yourself thinking just going halfway down will do the job ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Joshua & Megan Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: This stake is new to us, but I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This stake is new to us, but I have some advice about how to install it. We read reviews that it was difficult to insert into the ground. We tried (in the winters of Minnesota) to put it in the ground and it was impossible. However, we boiled 3 pots of water and poured it into the ground. MUCH, MUCH easier.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I tie two dogs to it and it’s still in place. (Weimaraner and bull dog)
customer_reviews.author: jayro C.

customer_reviews.title: My dog gets tangled around this because it won't go far enough in the ground
customer_reviews.text: My dog gets tangled around this thing regardless of the swivel... so frustrating. I can't get it far enough in the ground to not get tangled around and I tried everything to get it in as far as possible. There is no way she would be able to get this out of the ground but because I cant get it down all the way she entangles herself. I guess I wish this was shorter...
customer_reviews.author: MicaelaRenee

customer_reviews.title: Great stake
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to put in, but I suppose that is for a reason so that it doesn't come out of the ground too easily. Can definitely handle a lot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: LPS

customer_reviews.title: Great dog stake
customer_reviews.text: My heavy tugger black lab can't even budge this thing. He's been known to pull stakes out of the ground and break the clasps on tie-outs (and collars!). Between this stake, a heavy duty tie out, and a Kong collar, we've finally been able to keep him contained when he's in the back yard (3/4 fenced in). You will DEFINITELY need a support to turn this into the ground, it's not like most spiral stakes or other similar products. The auger digs deep and you WILL need a crow bar or other similar tool to thread through the loop and use for leverage. Well worth the effort though.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. There were mixed reviews if it would hold in the ground. I have a VERY active large husky that has pulled up several types of steaks and so far it is holding. Does take a lot to get it into the ground. You have to twist it with something to get it in but it is very worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Great but needs a better coating for longer use
customer_reviews.text: This stake works. My 70 lbs German Sheppard put some stress on this stake. I wasnt happy that the paint stating chipping not long after it was installed and it eventually bent under stress BUT the big thing is it never came out of the ground and my dog never ran away.
customer_reviews.author: charvey

customer_reviews.title: So easy to put in the ground with a hammer
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put in the ground with a hammer. Took me a couple of seconds and now my dog is secure. He can't pull it out. He's a 75 lb Labrador.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough for us!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews again and realizing I needed a broomstick handle to actually get this in the ground, I love it! It went in smooth and holds my Bernese Mountain/Golden Doodle pup just fine!
customer_reviews.author: MommyDutch

customer_reviews.title: this is amazing. I have a Brittany dog and she is ...
customer_reviews.text: this is amazing. I have a Brittany dog and she is very hyper/active. I bought one of these at store and she tore right thru it. This stake does not budge and holds its place. She loves to run around yard and this allows her to play without me worrying she'll break free and run away. thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to leave up to whatever height so you can ...
customer_reviews.text: use this to secure 2 pups, both @70 lbs, on 30' cable. they run and play on this when we're at games and they can't run free. Sits in the ground very securely, easy to leave up to whatever height so you can easily see it if you're worried about running over it w/the lawnmower.
customer_reviews.author: JulieD

customer_reviews.title: One of the better ones
customer_reviews.text: One of the better ones I have used, there is always that risk of forgetting about the stake and running into it with the mower. You could use one with a chain at the top.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grigsby

customer_reviews.title: Significant dog tie-out stake.
customer_reviews.text: You're goanna need a hammer to get it started and to put inside the eyelet on top for leverage when screwing it down.
customer_reviews.author: John Owen

customer_reviews.title: perfect for our dog
customer_reviews.text: we have a large unfenced yard and now my dog is able to run and play. she learned the limit of the run right away.....she is so happy to be out in the yard but you have to watch the cord doesn't tangle around your feet they run quickly around you and will make you fall....
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: Huge HUGE Tie Out Stake
customer_reviews.text: It's really big and heavy - much bigger and heavier than I thought it was going to be. If you need something huge and sturdy that gives you the extra peace of mind that your dog cannot get this out of the ground or is a big puller, then this product is for you.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.J.

customer_reviews.title: SOLID
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to install. I carry water around wherever this need impaling. This tie out stake is HUGE! Anything less than 75lb is excessive. It may even be a hindrance. It is probably the same weight and size as carrying a machete around.
customer_reviews.author: vmleopard

customer_reviews.title: But I got it in there and it holds my dog just fine. Never have to worry about my dog pulling ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly difficult to get in to the ground, even soft ground with rain. But I got it in there and it holds my dog just fine. Never have to worry about my dog pulling the stake out of the ground, even in a panic. Worth the $$ for sure.
customer_reviews.author: NickJG

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Will buy again! *I was not compensated for this review.
customer_reviews.author: FrecksMom

customer_reviews.title: extremely strong
customer_reviews.text: this is excellent. my dog is incredibly strong when he sees a squirrel and it doesn't even budge!
customer_reviews.author: C. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The description says "giant" and this thing is exactly that. I think this would contain even the most excitable of dogs. It's extremely sturdy. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LovesAGoodRead

customer_reviews.title: Works great and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Got this because our chocolate lab kept pulling the $10 Walmart stakes out of the ground or bending them, this hasn't moved an inch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, use it during my camping trips to keep my lab in campground. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Carl W Spangenberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These are the best of tie-out stakes. I have two Maremmas and while they were growing up they had to be tied up when not supervised. These are the best of the best and can hold a small mammoth I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: linen53

customer_reviews.title: A strong tie out for string dogs
customer_reviews.text: I feel safe with my husky in the backyard with this tie out! It took 5 minutes to install as you have to use a pole to get it all the way in the ground. Once in, it's not going anywhere
customer_reviews.author: D Szew

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this
customer_reviews.text: If you can get it in the ground it will work. Good luck though. If I had a time machine I would go back and play the lottery and not make this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: it doesn't move easily. We have a puppy that loves to run ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard to get into the ground, but once it's there, it doesn't move easily. We have a puppy that loves to run and she hasn't figured out how to pull it out of the ground yet!
customer_reviews.author: KristinF

customer_reviews.title: Let the puppies run free! (sorta)
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my two dogs (combined 30 pounds). Lets them run and play without me having to worry about them taking off! Highly recommend this product to any dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and rust resistant
customer_reviews.text: Solid, and with a decent coating to prevent rust. This thing prevents my pit bull from tearing off after squirrels, and she's very strong. I found it easy to install, given a little elbow grease.
customer_reviews.author: S. Juice

customer_reviews.title: My dog bent this on the first day.. ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog bent this on the first day...it still works but sure is a pain to put back in the ground bent.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal, i have a 75 pound pit/hound mix and this thing isnt going anywhere. My secret, use a broom handle to turn it into the ground.... be aware you get extremely dizzy.
customer_reviews.author: TaNgYs Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy-duty stake-out!
customer_reviews.text: This is very large and sturdy. It requires a broomstick through the handle to work it into the ground, but it will not come out anytime soon. I have a lab and it stands up to her strength.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: very strong! Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: This thing is strong! I got if for my German Shepard and no problems what so ever . It hasent pulled out or bent like the smaller corkscrew type . This is great for large dogs!
customer_reviews.author: I AM UNICRON

customer_reviews.title: Don't get the corkscrew type!
customer_reviews.text: The corkscrew type of stake runs into rocks and is sometimes too hard to twist into the ground. You simply hammer this one in and your done. It's heavy duty and and take the pounding.
customer_reviews.author: Artie

customer_reviews.title: Good anchor for my two dogs
customer_reviews.text: Very strong. Good anchor for my two dogs. They never get caught up on the anchor itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works!!
customer_reviews.text: hard to get into ground but the only stake my dogs cannot pull out!!
customer_reviews.author: jessica mcclain

customer_reviews.title: Works well in my yard
customer_reviews.text: This stake went into the ground easily and has not budged since. The orange color makes it easy to see and avoid tripping/mowing over. All around great product.
customer_reviews.author: clark ross leininger

customer_reviews.title: Product works really well and its easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Product works really well and its easy to install. I had a 120 lb Alaskan Malamute and it worked great. Good corrosion resistance also.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Bereznak

customer_reviews.title: Not for dogs over 100 lbs !!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for one week before our Mastiff bent it he's only a puppy at just 119 pounds pretty sure the stake is supposed to be rated for above that
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Its tough to get into the ground, which I'm perfectly okay with except for the part where my dog (92 pound American Staffordshire) managed to bend it the first time he was tied out on it and eventually pull it out of the ground. This might be suitable for smaller breeds but this is absolutely not suitable for larger, stronger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Norman

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My front yard doesn't have a fence and it is where my kids play. My dog loves to play with them and now he can. This holds nicely and isn't horrible to install in the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Lali

customer_reviews.title: Yes the orange chips off - but this stake is awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my second of these stakes - (the first I gave to a friend who adopted my foster). It's super easy to put in the beach, holds very well, I LOVE the swivel at the top so the dog doesn't loop the lead around the top and shorten it or get tangled), and it's easy to take out. Sure - when you hammer it with anything but a rubber hammer the orange paint will chip just off the top (who cares?). This is an awesome stake. I left this one at the beach house for next time - but I will likely buy one for in-town just in case we ever need it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but impossible to screw into the ground.
customer_reviews.text: It is very sturdy and will contain a crazy Wiemeraner BUT it was IMPOSSIBLE TO SCREW INTO THE GROUND! We had to dig a hole and use concrete to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: JanBrown

customer_reviews.title: For very active dog
customer_reviews.text: Our fence is falling and so our dog has to be kept tied up. This allows her plenty of room to run without letting her get out of the backyard. Very easy to put into ground that has been moistened, not so easy when the ground is dry.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hutto

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Needed serving strong for my dog while we were at my in-laws and this worked great! It does chip easily but that can always be repainted so I'm not too worried about it.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Agrasto

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could use it
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it would be great to use if we can get it in the ground. Not the best auger in the world. Very long but sturdy post.
customer_reviews.author: blind love

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase! Our 40lb dog is apparently an evil ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome purchase! Our 40lb dog is apparently an evil genius and can bend the other stakes embarrassingly easily. This one has lasted us for over 6 months and still holds perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Third stake
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stake in that it is sturdy and also moves with the animal so the cable does not get tangled.. The one i will be replacing has been in the ground for over a year and my dog was able to bend it slightly so that it now no longer lays flush.
customer_reviews.author: joan windschitl

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Extra Large Dog
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a 110 lb. Great Pyrenees. Works great! Easy to install and has been very reliable. Would recommend it to anyone. :)
customer_reviews.author: D. King

customer_reviews.title: Great product for even the most active dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This simple design works the best for holding our dog on the line for nighttime. It's very easy to install and hasn't budged a bit out of the ground for our rambunctious dog. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great stake! Held our three small dogs with tie outs, with no problems at all. Easy to get into ground.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Stays put
customer_reviews.text: This thing is not going anywhere! Very durable and visible to prevent mowing or tripping over it. It is hard to get in the ground though.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, secure. I haven't thought about this thing for months, which shows that it is doing its job.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle J. Feldmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Remains in place
customer_reviews.text: we have been through many cords with my dog, but this stake has remained constant. I love the color because it makes it easy to see while mowing.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Boy is it strong
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and it goes deep into the ground. I have tried every chain on my dog and he has managed to get free. So far with this product it is holding him well. No more roaming the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle V.

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: holds boxer/ridgeback mix would hold larger dog too. Easy install, easy to remove. Works great. 1 2 3 4 5
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Very strong
customer_reviews.text: Just great. Our pit bull loves it. He can spend a lot of time with us in the yard and he can't pull this out of the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Nizen

customer_reviews.title: Long and strong!
customer_reviews.text: It was a lot bigger than I expected, but I was able to get it in the ground. I have a beagle that pulls hard at rabbit and this is great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durability!!
customer_reviews.text: VERY strong and works with our VERY strong 65 lb. dog!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Myers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy design and the color makes it easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This tie out has worked great with my 75 lb dog. No problems yet a couple months in.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Sparkles

customer_reviews.title: Hardcore!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a beast and she cannot budge this stake! If there were a tornado, my husband said he would tie us to this stake! SO strong! :)
customer_reviews.author: Allison Plueger

customer_reviews.title: Great product but was hard to get in ground
customer_reviews.text: Hard to install but is very strong and works great for my 90 lb Lab.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Appelbaum

customer_reviews.title: Priceless
customer_reviews.text: This thing is worth 5x as much as it's sold for. SUPER solid construction, very easy to put into the ground, and works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Staci PK

customer_reviews.title: but works great.
customer_reviews.text: Holds my 70 lb dog even when he lunges forward. Was tough to get all the way into the ground, but works great.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great in our yard. We have no trouble mowing around it.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo

customer_reviews.title: Could not get this in the ground!
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to install. My husband and I tried a number of different sites. Even after rain this still would stick out like 10 inches. My husband ended up just burying it. Also the pain chipped off easily so not sure how long until it rusts. Even after burying it, it sways when the dogs pull. Luckily it's intended use is just to let the dogs out in the front yard with me while I garden, so as long as I'm always there to watch them, I'm not too worried about them pulling it out and running off. Would not buy again. Would've been better off with the cheaper spiral kind!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It worked on the beach with an excited 55lb puppy!
customer_reviews.author: JKP

customer_reviews.title: Giant Tie out Stake
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my dog she weighs about 30 lbs and would never be able to pull this out of the ground. Would definitely recommend buying this..I might buy another for the front yard so she has a choice of which door to go out.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W.

customer_reviews.title: This is extremely thick and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great and sturdy product, reminds me of a power line guy anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and held my 80+ lb
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and held my 80+ lb. dog. Kept her from digging under the fence and running out into traffic.
customer_reviews.author: sn

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have two big Labs (100 and 85 pounds) and am in a rental unit in a rural area, so cannot have a fence. This stake holds their tie-out and I have peace of mind knowing they are not going to break loose.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGold

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got this so I could put my dogs out back, we're on a cow farm and safety is big for me as my dogs are not livestock friendly. This definitely does the job, I have no worries about my dogs pulling it loose.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beach!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a beach trip to tether our two Belgian Tervurens. I took a tip from a review and used a sawed off broom handle to screw it into the sand. It takes a while but it could not be pulled out when pulling from the sides. If you pull straight up from the stand it can come out but that is not how a dog would be pulling. I can imagine this being very sturdy and secure in dirt but perhaps something you'd want to leave in once set.
customer_reviews.author: AndyR

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This tie out stake allows me to feel secure in the fact that my dogs are safe and will not pull it out of the ground!
customer_reviews.author: K. O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: This thing is impossible to get into the ground. My boyfriend has blisters from trying to get it in the ground for 2 hours! With the help of a sledgehammer.. It is now in about 3 inches deep and covered by some rocks. It has stayed in for a month but I don't think it's lasting much longer. The bottom piece is really just a flat circle. It needs to be more slanted so it can turn/cut into the ground. It's impossible to pound a flat circle into the ground..
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Held my 60 pound hound with no problem and easy to install!
customer_reviews.author: Pana Buescher

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and strong. Holds very well. The finish came off fairly quickly though.
customer_reviews.author: Laura E. Hashim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We have a dutch shepherd, that kind of says it all.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Yoast

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stays in place, my dog hasn't escaped and hasn't been tangled on this.
customer_reviews.author: lilpocketknife

product_meta.title: Tie Out Stake for Dogs
product_meta.description: Size:28 Inch| Color:OrangeThe Giant Tie-Out Stake was designed to firmly anchor large dogs. The stake is 28" long and made of solid steel that has been powder coated to inhibit rust.
feature_bullets: Four Paws tie-out cables help keep dogs secure while giving them room to roam
Helps prevent dogs from escaping the yard
Anchors firmly for use with large dogs; heavy-duty steel stake measures 28 inches
